name: Beto's Delivery Tower
description:
Beto's Delivery Tower

In a world post-climate-disaster-escaped, humanity has entered an accelerated age of space exploration as a result of the aftermath of the third Carbon Exclusion Event, which finally managed to get the planet back on track, at the cost of the northern hemisphere.

You play as Roberto, a retired truck driver who has decided to try his luck at the business of making deliveries on Europa, the latest of the moons of Jupiter to be inhabited by researchers. You must complete your deliveries within 2 minutes or the customers won't pay! And remember, since you are your own boss and only employee in this company, it's not like you can fire yourself.

Controls:
  • W to Accelerate Forwards (A on Xbox / CROSS on Dualshock)
  • S to Accelerate Backwards (B on Xbox / CIRCLE on Dualshock)
  • A to Turn Left (L1 Left)
  • D to Turn Right (L1 Right)
  • SPACE to Jump (X on Xbox / SQUARE on Dualshock)
  • R to Restart from the Last Checkpoint (Start on Xbox / Options on Dualshock)
Attributions:
  • Space exploration 3D pack Free 3D model by beamstudios (That jupiter in the background for the skybox and cover? from here, pretty neat assets)
  • 25 FREE Displacement Maps for Terrain by Jose Vega (The terrain in the skybox you only pay attention to when you fall of the track? It's displacements come from here, great resource)
  • Many of Kenney's 3D asset kits (the tower was pretty much kitbashed from their assets, the checkpoint and end poles were made by me so that I would start practicing blender)
  • Contains samples of "The river" by Lorentz, Pare, direction, writing., Crosby, Floyd, 1899-1985, photography., Van Dyke, Willard, photography., Woodard, Stacy, photography., Nosler, Lloyd, 1900-1985, editing., Zochling, Leo, editing., Chalmers, Thomas, 1884-1966, narration., United States. Farm Security Administration., AFI/Sheerin (Robert M.) Collection (Library of Congress), Museum of Modern Art Collection (Library of Congress), and Young (Robert) Collection (Library of Congress). Retrieved from Library of Congress, Motion Picture, Broadcasting, and Recorded Sound Division.
  • Contains samples of "The river" by Lorentz, Pare, direction, writing., Crosby, Floyd, 1899-1985, photography., Van Dyke, Willard, photography., Woodard, Stacy, photography., Nosler, Lloyd, 1900-1985, editing., Zochling, Leo, editing., Chalmers, Thomas, 1884-1966, narration., United States. Farm Security Administration., AFI/Sheerin (Robert M.) Collection (Library of Congress), Museum of Modern Art Collection (Library of Congress), and Young (Robert) Collection (Library of Congress). Retrieved from Library of Congress, Motion Picture, Broadcasting, and Recorded Sound Division.
